pullRequest.title: Adding CI/CD process for hosting minified javascript libraries
pullRequest.bodyText: Adding CI/CD process for building minified javascript libraries and hosting them on a GCS bucket for use in BigQuery UDFs

afterCommit.message: Adding CI/CD process for building minified javascript libraries and hosting them on a GCS bucket for use in BigQuery UDFs

nodes.bodyText: any reason for this to be a separate cloud build rather than add steps here?
nodes.diffHunk:

+# Step 1: Build and host all js libs in GCS
+###########################################################
+- name: gcr.io/google.com/cloudsdktool/cloud-sdk
+  entrypoint: 'gcloud'
+  args:
+    - builds
+    - submit
+    - udfs/js_libs
+    - --config=udfs/js_libs/cloudbuild.yaml

+# Adding a Javascript Library for use in a BigQuery UDF
+
+Complete the following 2 steps to host an npm package in the bigquery-utils GCS bucket. \
+You can then import the npm package into your BigQuery UDF using the following syntax:
+```
+CREATE FUNCTION myFunc(a FLOAT64, b STRING)
+  RETURNS STRING
+  LANGUAGE js
+  OPTIONS ( 
+    library=["gs://bqutil-lib/LIBRARY_NAME-vA.B.C.min.js"]

nodes.bodyText:
It might be nice to have a small script that does all 3 of these steps.
This way  you can use the logic for pushing to a (randomly named) GCS bucket when running the UDF tests.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,36 @@
+# Google Cloud Build script for bqutils
+#
+# This build script is used to unit test the BigQuery UDFs for every
+# change pushed to the udfs/ directory.
+#
+# Manual Execution:
+# Use the below command to invoke the build manually. Note the substitutions for
+# BRANCH_NAME and REVISION_ID. These variables are normally populated when the
+# build is executed via build triggers but will be empty during manual
+# execution. Dummy branch and revisions can be passed during manual execution so
+# the artifacts can be uploaded upon build completion.
+#
+# gcloud builds submit . --config=cloudbuild.yaml
+#
+
+steps:

afterCommit.message: Adding CI/CD process for building minified javascript libraries and hosting them on a GCS bucket for use in BigQuery UDFs

nodes.bodyText:
nit: remove step_${num}_ prefix
reasoning:

cloud build already prefixes all logs w. Step # ${num} - and this will create stutter in the logs.
If a contributor add steps they  have to go in and update all these id numbers.

speed it up! use gsutil -m to parallelize uploads

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
              args:
          
          
            
              args:
          
          
            
                - "-m"

All these cloud build steps are extremely inefficient (slow / expensive) and not easy for a contributor to replicate locally (for example if they do not have python 3.8 installed locally).
Instead define a dockerfile and build / cache it (for speed). This way the contributor can just build your dockerfile and use it to run tests. This will make it very easy to contribute from a browser in github codespaces once it goes GA (or from any machine w/ docker installed).
You can read about the advantages of this approach in my other PR here.
To give you and idea of what it would look like here (of course I'd also recommend adding more python linters to catch common issues):
Dockerfile.ci
FROM python:3.8.0-slim
WORKDIR /ci
COPY . /ci/
RUN pip3 install -r tests/requirements.txt
# This can be overriden in cloud build
ENTRYPOINT ["tests/udf_test_utils.py"] 
cloudbuild.yaml
# steps 1 & 2 ...
- name: 'hadolint/hadolint'  # optional
  entrypoint: '/bin/hadolint'
  args:
    - 'Dockerfile.ci'
  id: 'lint-ci-docker-image'
- name: 'gcr.io/kaniko-project/executor:latest'
  waitFor:
    - 'lint-ci-docker-image'
  args:
    - '--dockerfile=Dockerfile.ci'
    - '--destination=gcr.io/$PROJECT_ID/bq_udf_ci'
    - '--cache=true'
  id: 'build-ci-image-from-kaniko-cache'
- name: gcr.io/$PROJECT_ID/bq_udf_ci
  id: 'create_test_datasets'  # use Dockerfile's ENTRYPOINT
  args:
    - --create_test_datasets
  env:
    - SHORT_SHA=${SHORT_SHA}
  waitFor:
    - 'build-ci-image-from-kaniko-cache'
  ###########################################################
  # Step 6: Create UDF signatures with empty bodies to prevent
  # UDF creation errors in next step when one UDF depends
  # on another UDF.
  ###########################################################
- name: gcr.io/$PROJECT_ID/bq_udf_ci
  id: 'create_udf_signatures'
  entrypoint: 'pytest'   # Overide entrypoint locally
  args:
    - --workers
    - '100'
    - tests/create_udf_signatures.py
  env:
    - SHORT_SHA=${SHORT_SHA}
  waitFor:
    - 'copy_js_to_gcs'
    - 'create_test_datasets'
 # etc...
Is this typo of FUNCTION?

nodes.bodyText: does this need JS_BUCKET?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -14,19 +14,143 @@
 #
 
 steps:
-###########################################################
-# Step 1: Run UDF Unit Tests
-###########################################################
-- name: python:3.8.0-slim
-  entrypoint: 'bash'
-  args: ['udfs/tests/run.sh', '--pip_install_before_run']
-  env: ['SHORT_SHA=$SHORT_SHA']
-###########################################################
-# Step 2: Deploy if all tests pass
-###########################################################
+  ###########################################################
+  # Step 0: Install npm packages
+  ###########################################################
+- name: 'node'
+  id: 'step_0_install_npm_packages'
+  entrypoint: 'npm'
+  args:
+    - install
+  dir: js_libs
+  ###########################################################
+  # Step 1: Build all js libraries for BigQuery UDFs
+  ###########################################################
+- name: 'node'
+  id: 'step_1_build_bq_js_libs'
+  entrypoint: 'npm'
+  args:
+    - run-script
+    - build-all-libs
+  dir: js_libs
+  waitFor:
+    - 'step_0_install_npm_packages'
+  ###########################################################
+  # Step 2: Copy libs to GCS bucket
+  ###########################################################
 - name: gcr.io/google.com/cloudsdktool/cloud-sdk
-  entrypoint: 'bash'
-  args: ['release/build.sh', '$BRANCH_NAME', '$_PR_NUMBER']
+  id: 'step_2_copy_js_to_gcs'
+  entrypoint: 'gsutil'
+  args:
+    - cp
+    - builds/*
+    - ${_JS_BUCKET}
+  dir: js_libs
+  waitFor:
+    - 'step_1_build_bq_js_libs'
+  ###########################################################
+  # Step 3: Create python virtual environment
+  ###########################################################
+- name: python:3.8.0-slim
+  id: 'step_3_create_python_venv'
+  entrypoint: 'python3'
+  args:
+    - -m
+    - venv
+    - /workspace/venv
+  waitFor:
+    - '-'
+  ###########################################################
+  # Step 4: Install python requirements for testing
+  ###########################################################
+- name: python:3.8.0-slim
+  id: 'step_4_pip_install'
+  entrypoint: '/workspace/venv/bin/python3'
+  args:
+    - -m
+    - pip
+    - install
+    - -r
+    - tests/requirements.txt
+  waitFor:
+    - 'step_3_create_python_venv'
+  ###########################################################
+  # Step 5: Create BigQuery datasets specifically for testing
+  ###########################################################
+- name: python:3.8.0-slim
+  id: 'step_5_create_test_datasets'
+  entrypoint: '/workspace/venv/bin/python3'
+  args:
+    - tests/udf_test_utils.py
+    - --create_test_datasets
+  env:
+    - SHORT_SHA=${SHORT_SHA}
+  waitFor:
+    - 'step_4_pip_install'
+  ###########################################################
+  # Step 6: Create UDF signatures with empty bodies to prevent
+  # UDF creation errors in next step when one UDF depends
+  # on another UDF.
+  ###########################################################
+- name: python:3.8.0-slim
+  id: 'step_6_create_udf_signatures'
+  entrypoint: '/workspace/venv/bin/python3'
+  args:
+    - -m
+    - pytest
+    - --workers
+    - '100'
+    - tests/create_udf_signatures.py
+  env:
+    - SHORT_SHA=${SHORT_SHA}
+  waitFor:
+    - 'step_2_copy_js_to_gcs'
+    - 'step_5_create_test_datasets'
+  ###########################################################
+  # Step 7: Create UDFs in the test dataset from step 5
+  ###########################################################
+- name: python:3.8.0-slim
+  id: 'step_7_create_udfs'
+  entrypoint: '/workspace/venv/bin/python3'
+  args:
+    - -m
+    - pytest
+    - --workers
+    - '100'
+    - tests/test_create_udfs.py
+  env:
+    - SHORT_SHA=${SHORT_SHA}

nit: Fix shellcheck issues for safety
shellcheck build.sh 

In build.sh line 18:
SCRIPT_DIR="$( cd "$(dirname "$0")" ; pwd -P )"
               ^------------------^ SC2164: Use 'cd ... || exit' or 'cd ... || return' in case cd fails.

Did you mean: 
SCRIPT_DIR="$( cd "$(dirname "$0")" || exit ; pwd -P )"


In build.sh line 81:
  if ! bq show --headless $dataset > /dev/null 2>&1; then
                          ^------^ SC2086: Double quote to prevent globbing and word splitting.

Did you mean: 
  if ! bq show --headless "$dataset" > /dev/null 2>&1; then


In build.sh line 82:
    bq mk --headless -d --data_location=${LOCATION} ${dataset}
                                                    ^--------^ SC2086: Double quote to prevent globbing and word splitting.

Did you mean: 
    bq mk --headless -d --data_location=${LOCATION} "${dataset}"


In build.sh line 105:
  printf "${BOLD}${file}${NORMAL}\n"
         ^-------------------------^ SC2059: Don't use variables in the printf format string. Use printf '..%s..' "$foo".


In build.sh line 107:
    bq query --dataset_id ${dataset} --headless --nouse_legacy_sql --dry_run "$(cat ${file})"
                          ^--------^ SC2086: Double quote to prevent globbing and word splitting.
                                                                                    ^-----^ SC2086: Double quote to prevent globbing and word splitting.

Did you mean: 
    bq query --dataset_id "${dataset}" --headless --nouse_legacy_sql --dry_run "$(cat "${file}")"


In build.sh line 109:
    bq query --dataset_id ${dataset} --headless --nouse_legacy_sql "$(cat ${file})"
                          ^--------^ SC2086: Double quote to prevent globbing and word splitting.
                                                                          ^-----^ SC2086: Double quote to prevent globbing and word splitting.

Did you mean: 
    bq query --dataset_id "${dataset}" --headless --nouse_legacy_sql "$(cat "${file}")"


In build.sh line 112:
  if [[ $? -gt 0 ]]; then
        ^-- SC2181: Check exit code directly with e.g. 'if mycmd;', not indirectly with $?.


In build.sh line 113:
    printf "Failed to create: $file"
           ^-----------------------^ SC2059: Don't use variables in the printf format string. Use printf '..%s..' "$foo".


In build.sh line 131:
  local sql_files=$(find ${UDF_DIR} -type f -name "*.sql")
        ^-------^ SC2155: Declare and assign separately to avoid masking return values.


In build.sh line 132:
  local num_files=$(echo "$sql_files" | wc -l)
        ^-------^ SC2155: Declare and assign separately to avoid masking return values.


In build.sh line 134:
    sed -i "s|\${JS_BUCKET}|${JS_BUCKET}|g" ${file}
                                            ^-----^ SC2086: Double quote to prevent globbing and word splitting.

Did you mean: 
    sed -i "s|\${JS_BUCKET}|${JS_BUCKET}|g" "${file}"


In build.sh line 142:
  --substitutions _JS_BUCKET=${JS_BUCKET},SHORT_SHA=${SHORT_SHA}
                             ^----------^ SC2086: Double quote to prevent globbing and word splitting.
                                                    ^----------^ SC2086: Double quote to prevent globbing and word splitting.

  --substitutions _JS_BUCKET="${JS_BUCKET}",SHORT_SHA="${SHORT_SHA}"


In build.sh line 145:
  if [[ $? -gt 0 ]]; then
        ^-- SC2181: Check exit code directly with e.g. 'if mycmd;', not indirectly with $?.


In build.sh line 173:
  local sql_files=$(find . -type f -name "*.sql")
        ^-------^ SC2155: Declare and assign separately to avoid masking return values.


In build.sh line 174:
  local num_files=$(echo "$sql_files" | wc -l)

In build.sh line 176:

In build.sh line 178:

Did you mean:

In build.sh line 180:

In build.sh line 181:

Did you mean:

In build.sh line 182:

Did you mean:

In build.sh line 200:

In build.sh line 250:

     ^-----------^ SC2086: Double quote to prevent globbing and word splitting.

Did you mean:

For more information:

nodes.bodyText:
TIL  you can do this for just a single PR (rather than all PRs)
source: https://gist.github.com/piscisaureus/3342247

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                  git fetch origin +refs/pull/*/merge:refs/remotes/origin/pr/*
          
          
            
                  git fetch origin +refs/pull/${_PR_NUMBER}/merge:refs/remotes/origin/pr/${_PR_NUMBER}
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -14,12 +14,36 @@
 #
 
 steps:
-###########################################################
-# Step 1: Deploy
-###########################################################
+  ############################################################
+  # Step 0: Initialize git repo to enable checking for changes
+  ############################################################
+- name: 'gcr.io/cloud-builders/git'
+  entrypoint: 'bash'
+  args:
+    - '-c'
+    - |
+      git init
+      git config user.email "builder@bigquery-utils.repo"
+      git config user.name "builder"
+
+      git commit -m "empty commit"
+      git remote add origin https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/bigquery-utils.git
+      git fetch origin master
+
+      # Fetch all PRs to get history for PRs created from forked repos
+      git fetch origin +refs/pull/*/merge:refs/remotes/origin/pr/*

commit.message:
Added CI/CD process for building minified javascript libraries and hosting them on a GCS bucket for use in BigQuery UDFs.
Optimized UDF deployment by performing UDF creation concurrently using python test framework.

beforeCommit.message: Removed tools/ directory from dry-runs since they're tested separately

afterCommit.message:
Added CI/CD process for building minified javascript libraries and hosting them on a GCS bucket for use in BigQuery UDFs.
Optimized UDF deployment by performing UDF creation concurrently using python test framework.

commit.message:
Fix naming of javascript libs that are written to GCS
Fixing version of compromise npm package

nodes.bodyText:
I recently had a look at this when adapting for current customer and noticed  a few issues:

not DRY (3x essentially the same code for no reason): solution shift
only supports -k pytest option (should easily support all pytest options e.g. -x for fail fast): solution $@ Special Parameter
The test scripts assumes SHORT_SHA env var is set (not the case when not in cloud build)
My suggestion is this (though you'd have to change references to SHORT_SHA to TEST_ID):

TEST_ID=$SHORT_SHA

# fall back on random string if SHORT_SHA not set
if [ -z "$TEST_ID" ]
then
  # shellcheck disable=SC2002
  TEST_ID=$(cat /dev/urandom | tr -dc 'a-z0-9_' | fold -w 32 | head -n 1)
fi

echo "Test ID: ${TEST_ID}"

if [[ $1 == "--pip_install_before_run" ]]; then
  shift
  python3 -m pip install -r tests/requirements.txt
fi
python3 tests/udf_test_utils.py --create_test_datasets
python3 -m pytest --workers 100 tests/create_udf_signatures.py $@
python3 -m pytest --workers 100 tests/test_create_udfs.py $@
python3 -m pytest --workers 100 tests/test_run_udfs.py $@
python3 tests/udf_test_utils.py --delete_test_datasets
Note that I might want to locally run the tests BEFORE committing so using short SHA of the most recent commit (git rev-parse --short HEAD) may be misleading.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -15,23 +15,23 @@
 # limitations under the License.
 
 if [[ $1 == "--pip_install_before_run" ]]; then

commit.message: Follow up on review comment to DRY-up helper run.sh script

Changed pytest worker count to be automatically determined based on environment core count
Added pytest option --tests-per-worker and set to 'auto' which will allocate at most 50 tests per worker
Added test cases for nlp_compromise_number and nlp_compromise_people javascript-based UDFs.
Changed underscores in python argument names to hyphens.
Removing unintentional space

Only create NULL function signatures for newly added UDFs when deploying in public facing dataset.
This prevents deployment process from temporarily changing existing UDFs to a NULL implementations.
Increase build timeout from default value of 10min to 30min

   local file=$1
-  local dataset=""
-  case $file in

nodes.bodyText: you do a lot of creating / deleteing fixtures for your test environment in cloud build / shell scripts when it would be better to use pytest fixtures to make things easier to run and ensure that things get cleaned up even if tests fail. this can be refactored in a future PR but might make things easier to reason about as your cloud builds can be simplified to "just running pytest".
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -14,19 +14,147 @@
 #
 
 steps:
-###########################################################
-# Step 1: Run UDF Unit Tests
-###########################################################
-- name: python:3.8.0-slim
-  entrypoint: 'bash'
-  args: ['udfs/tests/run.sh', '--pip_install_before_run']
-  env: ['SHORT_SHA=$SHORT_SHA']
-###########################################################
-# Step 2: Deploy if all tests pass
-###########################################################
+  ############################################################
+  # Dynamically create the package.json file based off the libs
+  # specified in the js_libs/js_libs.yaml file.
+  ############################################################
+- name: gcr.io/$PROJECT_ID/bq_udf_ci
+  id: generate_js_libs_package_json
+  entrypoint: python3
+  args:
+    - tests/udf_test_utils.py
+    - --generate-js-libs-package-json
+  ###########################################################
+  # Install npm packages based off the package.json file
+  # created in the previous step.
+  ###########################################################
+- name: node
+  id: install_npm_packages
+  entrypoint: npm
+  args:
+    - install
+  ############################################################
+  # Dynamically create webpack config files needed by webpack
+  # to build npm packages into single .js files which will be
+  # hosted on GCS and used by BigQuery UDFs.
+  ############################################################
+- name: gcr.io/$PROJECT_ID/bq_udf_ci
+  id: generate_webpack_configs
+  entrypoint: python3
+  args:
+    - tests/udf_test_utils.py
+    - --generate-webpack-configs
+  waitFor:
+    - install_npm_packages
+    - generate_js_libs_package_json
+  ###########################################################
+  # Build (via webpack) all js libraries for BigQuery UDFs
+  ###########################################################
+- name: node
+  id: build_bq_js_libs
+  entrypoint: npm
+  args:
+    - run-script
+    - build-all-libs
+  waitFor:
+    - generate_webpack_configs
+    - install_npm_packages
+  ###########################################################
+  # Copy all libs to GCS bucket
+  ###########################################################
 - name: gcr.io/google.com/cloudsdktool/cloud-sdk
-  entrypoint: 'bash'
-  args: ['release/build.sh', '$BRANCH_NAME', '$_PR_NUMBER']
+  id: copy_js_to_gcs
+  entrypoint: gsutil
+  args:
+    - '-m'
+    - cp
+    - js_builds/*
+    - ${_JS_BUCKET}
+  waitFor:
+    - build_bq_js_libs
+  ###########################################################
+  # Create BigQuery datasets specifically for testing

+    :return: Input UDF DDL with a NULL body

+

+def get_test_bq_dataset(udf_path):
+    """
+    For a given path to a UDF DDL file, return the BigQuery dataset name in
+    which to test the UDF. The test dataset name is the same as production
+    but with the suffix, _test_$SHORT_SHA, appended. The $SHORT_SHA value comes
+    from the commit which triggered the build.
+    :param udf_path: Path to the UDF DDL .sql file
+    :return: Name of test dataset
+    """
+    udf_parent_dir_name = Path(udf_path).parent.name
+    if os.getenv('SHORT_SHA') is not None:
+        bq_dataset = get_dir_to_dataset_mappings().get(udf_parent_dir_name)
+        return f'{bq_dataset}{DATASET_SUFFIX}'

         client.delete_dataset(dataset, delete_contents=True, not_found_ok=True)

commit.message: Addressing review comments

nodes.bodyText: add newline
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,40 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env bash
+
+# Copyright 2021 Google LLC
+#
+# Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
+# you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
+# You may obtain a copy of the License at
+#
+#     http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
+#
+# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
+# distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
+# WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
+# See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
+# limitations under the License.
+
+# Only compare with master branch if this build has been triggered
+# by either a non-master branch on origin repo or a pull request.
+if [[ ! "${BRANCH_NAME}" = "master" || -n "${_PR_NUMBER}" ]]; then
+  git init
+  git config user.email "builder@bigquery-utils.repo"
+  git config user.name "builder"
+  printf "Adding repo %s as a remote" "${_REPO_URL}"
+  git remote remove origin # Removing necessary when testing locally
+  git remote add origin "${_REPO_URL}"
+  git fetch origin master
+
+  # Fetch the pull request which triggered this build and then
+  # hard reset to it. The build.sh script can then call "git diff"
+  # to figure out what to build based on what's changed.
+  if [[ ! "${BRANCH_NAME}" = "master" && -z "${_PR_NUMBER}" ]]; then
+    printf "Fetching and --hard resetting to (%s) branch from origin repo." "${BRANCH_NAME}"
+    git fetch origin "${BRANCH_NAME}"
+    git reset --hard origin/"${BRANCH_NAME}"
+  elif [[ -n "${_PR_NUMBER}" ]]; then
+    printf "Fetching and --hard resetting to the merge commit of pull request #%s which triggered this build." "${_PR_NUMBER}"
+    git fetch origin +refs/pull/"${_PR_NUMBER}"/merge:refs/remotes/origin/pr/"${_PR_NUMBER}"
+    git reset --hard origin/pr/"${_PR_NUMBER}"
+  fi
+fi

Fixing git_init script to refer to head of PR when fetching changes

Merge branch 'jsudf_cicd' of https://github.com/danieldeleo/bigquery-utils into jsudf_cicd
Adding no-cache-dir flag to dockerfile
